title: Signature not added to replies or forwarding messages
content: I've installed the latest desktop version of Thunderbird to evaluate. The signature is added only for new messages and not included when replying or forwarding a message. I've tested the signature with both plain text and html signature - both doesn't work as expected. I've also tried pasting the html code in the input field and attaching it as a file. Is this an intentional omission of functionality or I'm I missing something? I'm attaching my account settings interface.
creator: erna3

title: Thunderbird Problem
content:
I'm running Thunderbird 138.0.3 (release update channel). I had an update in the past few days and now it is having a problem. Thunderbird starts OK but it I use another program for several minutes when I go back to Thunderbird its window is not visible. Looking at my system monitor Thunderbird is using a lot of CPU. The only way I can proceed is to kill Thunderbird from the system monitor. No crash report is generated. Running in safe mode does not help.

If I run Thunderbird from a terminal I get: $ thunderbird [64132] Sandbox: CanCreateUserNamespace() unshare(CLONE_NEWPID): EPERM ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment.

This seems pertinent as it it to do with graphics but the web seems to suggest it in not important.

I have copied the Troubleshooting information to a text file and so can share it but it is quite large does not seem appropriate to include it here.

Any help gratefully received.
creator: ikproudler1

title: Calendar Notifications Stopped for "All Day" Events
content:
I am no longer receiving calendar notifications for events which are entered as "all day" events on my Google calendar.

I had a similar problem about three years ago when I wasn't receiving notifications for ANY events on my Google calendar. I attempted to solve this problem in a similar fashion by uninstalling/reinstalling Thunderbird then disconnect/reconnecting Google Calendar as discussed in the following link, but the All Day events' notifications still are not appearing.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1397571

As a debugging step/temporary solution (so I don't miss notifications), I have integrated my Google Calendar with Outlook, and am receiving notifications correctly with that app, so the problem doesn't appear to be on the Google end.
creator: jerrylcanterbury

title: unable to set up new hotmail account in Thunderbird
content: I have been trying to get Thunderbird to read a new hotmail inbox. At first it seemed to set up the new email account okay and I could send messages from it successfully but none of the messages on the outlook server would display - it said there was nothing there. I tried deleting the profile then reinstalling numerous times to no effect. The automatic set up of the smtp and OAuth settings seemed to be okay. But now when I try again to install the hotmail profile I am getting the following message: Component returned failure code Ox80550014 [nsMsgIncomingServer.verifyLogon] It then sticks at 'checking password'
creator: chrisbrazier1955

title: New login error
content: Hi. I've never had problems with Thunderbird before but recently I can't get my new emails. I get an error that says "Login to server pop.gmail.com with username *****@telus.net failed." I click retry and get the same thing again. After that I get "Sending of username did not succeed. Mail server pop.gmail.com responded: Too many commands before auth e21mb51124658oos". Any ideas to help fix this? It was all working fine until all of a sudden it wasn't. I made no changes to anything. I have no problem getting my email on gmail or in Outlook. Thanks
